item.title: China augmented reality start-up Rokid gets US$70 million in new funding round led by Hefei government
item.description:
Summary：

Chinese augmented reality firm Rokid has raised 500 million yuan in its latest funding round led by the municipal government of Hefei, Anhui province. The investment and cooperation agreement signed between Rokid and Hefei aims to advance the local metaverse industry and drive innovation in XR/metaverse applications and technologies. Rokid will set up its industrial metaverse headquarters, ecosystem hub, and R&D center in Hefei's New Station Hi-Tech Zone.
  • Abstract: Rokid raises funds to establish its industrial metaverse headquarters in Hefei.
  • Theme: Rokid's collaboration with the Hefei government to develop the metaverse industry.
  • Viewpoint: Government support for tech start-ups and the growing trend of local authorities investing in projects aligned with local development strategies.
  • Main information: Rokid's funding amount, investment and cooperation agreement with Hefei, establishment of its industrial metaverse headquarters in Hefei, and focus on cutting-edge R&D and user experience optimization.

总结：

中国增强现实（AR）技术公司Rokid在最新一轮融资中筹集了近5亿元人民币，由中国当地政府领投。Rokid与安徽省合肥市政府签署了投资合作协议，旨在推进当地元宇宙产业发展，推动XR/元宇宙应用和技术创新。Rokid将在合肥新站高新区设立其工业元宇宙总部、生态中心和研发中心。
  • 摘要：Rokid融资设立工业元宇宙总部于合肥。
  • 主题：Rokid与合肥政府合作发展元宇宙产业。
  • 观点：政府对科技初创企业的支持以及地方政府投资与当地发展战略相一致的趋势。
  • 主要信息：Rokid的融资金额、与合肥的投资合作协议、在合肥设立工业元宇宙总部以及专注于前沿研发和用户体验优化。

单词：

  • augmented reality (AR) - 增强现实。

    原文例句：Rokid Glass, augmented reality glasses, at the Rokid booth during CES 2018, Las Vegas. Photo: AFP

    例句讲解：augmented reality (AR) 是由augment（增加）和reality（现实）组成的，意为“增强现实”。它是一种将虚拟信息叠加到真实世界中的技术，从而创造出一种增强现实感。在这个例句中，它指的是Rokid Glass，一种增强现实眼镜。

  • equity investor - 股权投资者。

    原文例句：Chinese authorities have increasingly stepped up as private equity investors in projects in line with local development strategies.

    例句讲解：equity investor 是由equity（股权）和investor（投资者）组成的，意为“股权投资者”。它是指那些投资于公司或企业的股权的人。在这个例句中，它指的是中国当局，因为他们越来越愿意投资于符合当地发展战略的项目。

  • metaverse - 元宇宙。

    原文例句：As part of the deal, Rokid signed an investment and cooperation agreement with Hefei to advance the local metaverse industry.

    例句讲解：metaverse 是由meta（超越）和verse（宇宙）组成的，意为“元宇宙”。它是指一个虚拟的世界，人们可以在其中进行各种活动，就像在现实世界中一样。在这个例句中，它指的是元宇宙产业，Rokid与合肥政府签署投资合作协议，旨在推进当地的元宇宙产业发展。

词组：

  • raise funds - 筹集资金。

    原文例句：Rokid said it has raised 500 million yuan in its latest funding round with the municipal government of Hefei as a lead investor.

    例句讲解：raise funds 是由raise（提升）和funds（资金）组成的，意为“筹集资金”。它指的是从投资者那里获得资金。在这个例句中，它指的是Rokid在最新一轮融资中筹集了5亿元人民币。

  • make investments - 进行投资。

    原文例句：As a quid pro quo for funding, local governments generally require these start-ups to make local investments.

    例句讲解：make investments 是由make（制造）和investments（投资）组成的，意为“进行投资”。它指的是将资金投入到某个项目或企业中。在这个例句中，它指的是地方政府通常要求这些初创企业在获得资助后进行当地投资。

  • drive innovation - 推动创新。

    原文例句：The cooperation between Rokid and Hefei builds on a shared vision to cultivate extended reality [XR]/metaverse industry development, ” Hong said.

    例句讲解：drive innovation 是由drive（驱动）和innovation（创新）组成的，意为“推动创新”。它指的是促进和鼓励新的想法和技术的发展。在这个例句中，它指的是Rokid与合肥的合作旨在推动扩展现实（XR）/元宇宙产业发展。

句子：

  • Rokid said in a statement on Wednesday that it has raised 500 million yuan (US$70 million) in its latest funding round with the municipal government of Hefei, capital of central Anhui province, as a lead investor. - Rokid在周三的一份声明中表示，在最新一轮融资中，该公司已筹集到5亿元人民币（7000万美元），由安徽省合肥市政府领投。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Rokid said，其中主语是Rokid，谓语是said，宾语是it has raised 500 million yuan in its latest funding round with the municipal government of Hefei, capital of central Anhui province, as a lead investor。in a statement on Wednesday是一个介词短语，表示在周三的一份声明中。as a lead investor是一个介词短语，表示作为领投方。这个句子的意思是说，Rokid在周三的一份声明中表示，在最新一轮融资中，该公司已筹集到5亿元人民币（7000万美元），由安徽省合肥市政府领投。

语法：

  • 过去式 - 表示过去发生的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Rokid Glass, augmented reality glasses, at the Rokid booth during CES 2018, Las Vegas. Photo: AFP

    语法讲解：这是一个过去式句子，表示在过去的某个时间点发生的动作或状态。其中，Rokid Glass, augmented reality glasses, at the Rokid booth during CES 2018, Las Vegas.是一个并列句，表示Rokid Glass，一种增强现实眼镜，在2018年的消费电子展（CES）期间在Rokid的展位上展出。Photo: AFP是一个说明句，表示照片：法新社。这个句子的意思是说，Rokid Glass，一种增强现实眼镜，在2018年的消费电子展（CES）期间在Rokid的展位上展出。照片：法新社。

  • 现在进行时 - 表示正在进行的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Chinese authorities have increasingly stepped up as private equity investors in projects in line with local development strategies.

    语法讲解：这是一个现在进行时句子，表示正在进行的动作或状态。其中，Chinese authorities have increasingly stepped up as private equity investors in projects in line with local development strategies.是一个主从复合句，主句是Chinese authorities have increasingly stepped up，其中主语是Chinese authorities，谓语是have increasingly stepped up，宾语是as private equity investors in projects in line with local development strategies。as private equity investors in projects in line with local development strategies是一个现在分词短语，作状语，表示作为与当地发展战略相一致的项目的私募股权投资者。这个句子的意思是说，中国当局越来越愿意投资于符合当地发展战略的项目。

  • Rokid said it has raised 500 million yuan in its latest funding round with the municipal government of Hefei as a lead investor
  • Rokid will set up its industrial metaverse headquarters, ecosystem hub and R&D centre in Hefei’s New Station Hi-Tech Zone

Chinese augmented reality (AR) technology firm Rokid has raised nearly half a billion yuan in its latest round of funding led by a local Chinese government, in a fresh indication of the backing from authorities for tech start-ups.

Rokid said in a statement on Wednesday that it has raised 500 million yuan (US$70 million) in its latest funding round with the municipal government of Hefei, capital of central Anhui province, as a lead investor. As part of the deal, Rokid signed an investment and cooperation agreement with Hefei to advance the local metaverse industry.

Chinese authorities have increasingly stepped up as private equity investors in projects in line with local development strategies. As a quid pro quo for funding, local governments generally require these start-ups to make local investments.

Under the Hefei deal, Rokid will set up its industrial metaverse headquarters, ecosystem hub and research and development (R&D) centre in Hefei’s New Station Hi-Tech Zone, tapping into the Chinese city’s emerging ecosystem including micro-displays, the metaverse and other areas.

“We are honoured to contribute to advancements in science/technology … through our innovations,” said Misa Zhu, founder and CEO of Rokid, adding that the company will focus on cutting-edge R&D and user experience optimisation.

“Looking ahead, we will maintain a focus on achieving technological milestones and enriching our ecosystem to empower developers and deliver superior products that benefit consumers and enterprises globally”, Zhu said.

China wants up to 5 metaverse companies with ‘global influence’ by 2025

Hong Fan, chairman of Hefei New Venture Investment Control, an investment vehicle under the Hefei government, added that the cooperation aligns with Rokid and the city’s efforts to drive innovation on metaverse applications and technologies.

“The cooperation between Rokid and Hefei builds on a shared vision to cultivate extended reality [XR]/metaverse industry development, ” Hong said.

XR is an overarching term that includes AR, virtual reality, and mixed reality technologies that seek to combine or mirror the physical and digital worlds to allow consumers, equipped with XR equipment, to traverse between and interact with them.

Founded in 2014, Rokid has made AR equipment for a variety of consumer, travel, and industrial uses, counting companies such as the State Grid Corporation of China and home appliance giant Midea among its clients.

item.title: Can Beethoven, Bach and Mozart help iPhone sales in China? Apple to launch classical music app on mainland amid sluggish demand for its flagship produ...
item.description:
Summary：

苹果音乐古典音乐应用程序将于1月24日在中国大陆发布，该应用程序此前已于去年3月在全球大部分市场推出。当天，该应用程序还将在其他五個东亚市场推出，包括香港、澳门、台湾、日本和韩国。苹果音乐古典音乐应用程序的发布可能会促进该公司在中国的主要数字服务业务，而中国是其在应用商店相关收入方面最大的市场。
  • Abstract: Apple Music Classical app to debut in China, targeting world's largest smartphone market.
  • Theme: Expanding Apple's digital services business in China despite declining iPhone sales.
  • Viewpoint: The significance of China as Apple's largest market for App Store revenue; the potential impact of the classical music app on iPhone sales.
  • Main information: Launch date and availability of the app in China and other East Asian markets; China's contribution to Apple's App Store revenue; declining iPhone sales in China; competition from Chinese smartphone vendors.

总结：

苹果音乐古典音乐应用将于1月24日在中国大陆发布，该应用程序此前已于去年3月在全球大部分市场推出。当天，该应用程序还将在其他五个东亚市场推出，其中包括香港、澳门、台湾、日本和韩国。苹果音乐古典音乐应用程序的发布可能会促进该公司在中国的主要数字服务 业务，而中国是其在应用商店相关收入方面最大的市场。
  • 摘要：Apple Music Classical应用将在中国首次亮相，目标是全球最大的智能手机市场。
  • 主题：尽管iPhone销量下降，但苹果仍在中国扩张其数字服务业务。
  • 观点：中国作为苹果应用商店收入最大市场的意义；古典音乐应用对iPhone销售的潜在影响。
  • 主要信息：该应用在中国和其他东亚市场的发布日期和可用性；中国对苹果应用商店收入的贡献；iPhone在中国的销量下降；来自中国智能手机供应商的竞争。

单词：

  • decline (v.) - /dɪˈklaɪn/ 拒绝，减少，下降。

    原文例句：In the first week of the year, iPhone sales on the mainland were down 30 per cent year year, according to a Jefferies research note published on Sunday.

    例句讲解：decline是一个下降的意思，是落下，降低或使降低的意思。在这里，它指iPhone的销量在过去的一年中下降了30%。

  • tough (adj.) - /tʌf/ 艰难的，困难的。

    原文例句：In addition, the company also faces tough competition from Chinese smartphone makers led by Huawei Technologies, Xiaomi and Honor.

    例句讲解：tough是一个形容词，指的是艰难或困难的意思。在这里，tough用于描述苹果公司面临着来自小米、荣耀和华为等中国智能手机制造商的激烈竞争。

词组：

  • in terms of - 就……而言，从……方面来说。

    原文例句：China generated US$570 billion, or 51 per cent, of total billings and sales facilitated by Apple’s App Store ecosystem in 2022, according to a study by consulting firm Analysis Group that was published in May 2023.

    例句讲解：in terms of是一个介词短语，中文意思是从……角度看。它通常用来表示某事物的某个方面或角度。在这个例句中，in terms of表示中国在苹果应用商店生态系统的总账单和销售额中所占的比例，即中国占了51%的比例。

  • on the mainland - 在中国大陆。

    原文例句：In the first week of the year, iPhone sales on the mainland were down 30 per cent year year, according to a Jefferies research note published on Sunday.

    例句讲解：on the mainland是一个介词，中文意思是在中国大陆。它通常用来表示在中国大陆地区。在这个例句中，on the mainland表示iPhone在过去的一年中在中国大陆的销量下降了30%。

句子：

  • The Apple Music Classical app, which was launched in most markets globally in March last year, will make its mainland debut on January 24. - 苹果音乐古典音乐应用程序将于1月24日在中国大陆首次亮相，该应用程序此前已于去年3月在全球大部分市场推出。

    句子分析：这是一个简单的陈述句，主语是The Apple Music Classical app，谓语是will make its mainland debut，宾语是on January 24。in most markets globally in March last year是一个介词短语，作时间状语，表示在去年3月全球大部分市场。这个句子的意思是说，苹果音乐古典音乐应用程序将于1月24日在中国大陆首次亮相，该应用程序此前已于去年3月在全球大部分市场推出。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：The company has been making iPhones and other products in India for several years, including the latest iPhone 15.

    语法讲解：这是一个常见的时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，它表示该公司一直从过去的几年开始在印度生产iPhone和其他产品，直到现在仍在进行。

  • 比较级和最高级 - 比较两个或多个事物或人之间的差异。

    原文例句：China accounted for US$570 billion, or 51 per cent, of the total US$1.1 trillion in billings and sales facilitated by the App Store ecosystem in 2022, according to a study by consulting firm Analysis Group that was published on Apple’s website in May last year.

    语法讲解：这是一个常见的语法结构，结构是：形容词或副词的比较级或最高级 + than + 被比较的人或事物。比较级表示两个事物或人之间的差异，最高级表示三个或更多事物或人之间的差异。在这个例句中，它表示中国在2022年苹果应用商店生态系统的总账单和销售额中所占的比例最高，为51%。

  • The Apple Music Classical app, which was launched in most markets globally in March last year, will make its mainland debut on January 24
  • On the same date, the app will also be available in five other East Asian markets that include Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan, Japan and South Korea

Apple will soon make its classical music app available in mainland China, expanding the US tech giant’s digital services offering in the world’s largest smartphone market where sales of the iPhone are seeing a deepening decline.

The Apple Music Classical app, which was launched in most markets globally in March last year, will make its mainland debut on January 24, according to the company’s online China App Store. The app – touted by Apple as the world’s largest classical music catalogue, with more than five million tracks – can now be pre-ordered by iPhone users in the country.

On the same date, the stand-alone app will also be available in five other East Asian markets that include Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan, Japan and South Korea, according to a post on Tuesday by Apple on X, formerly Twitter.

The app’s launch is likely to bolster Apple’s major digital services business in China, which remains the company’s largest market in terms of App Store-related revenue.

China accounted for US$570 billion, or 51 per cent, of the total US$1.1 trillion in billings and sales facilitated by the App Store ecosystem in 2022, according to a study by consulting firm Analysis Group that was published on Apple’s website in May last year.

By comparison, the United States generated US$273 billion, or almost 25 per cent, of the App Store ecosystem’s overall billings and sales in 2022. Europe accounted for US$119 billion, or 11 per cent, of that year’s total.

Whether the classical music app’s local release would somehow help lift iPhone sales on the mainland remains to be seen, as consumption remains weak across the country and Apple faces stiff competition from major Chinese smartphone rivals.

In the first week of the year, iPhone sales on the mainland were down 30 per cent year on year, according to a Jefferies research note published on Sunday. The brokerage indicated that there was “a big rise in discounts” for the iPhone 14 and 14 Plus models, while the newer iPhone 15 and 15 Plus models saw “a moderate rise” in discounts.

Apple supplier Foxconn sees sales decline in first quarter of 2024 amid weak demand

Chinese smartphone vendors, with Huawei Technologies, Xiaomi and Honor leading the pack, had “much stronger” momentum during the period, with sales delivering “flattish growth” year on year, Jefferies analysts led by Edison Lee wrote in the note.

The iPhone’s total sales volume last year on the mainland was down 3 per cent from 2022, which translated to a 0.4 per cent decline in Apple’s market share, according to Jefferies. It estimated that rival Huawei saw its mainland market share in the December quarter gain 2 per cent from the previous quarter, and 6 per cent year on year.

Apple is expected to see “even higher revenue pressure” on the mainland in 2024, according to Jefferies.

Still, Apple has continued to reassure investors even though iPhone sales have been slowing. In the firm’s earnings call in November, Apple chief executive Tim Cook said: “Over the long term, I view China as an incredibly important market, and I’m very optimistic about it.”

Cook made two visits to the mainland last year, meeting senior government officials, Chinese developers and Apple’s contract manufacturing partners.

item.title: Foxconn pushes into electric vehicle production near its biggest iPhone plant amid slow smartphone sales
item.description:
Summary：

The Apple company, seeing the potential of the new energy vehicle (NEV) industry, has established a new business venture called Foxconn New Energy Automobile Industry Development (Henan) Co. Located in Zhengzhou, China, this venture will focus on car component manufacturing, motor production, and NEV sales. Foxconn aims to leverage its expertise in electronics to capture growth opportunities in the automotive sector given the declining demand for smartphones and consumer gadgets.
  • Abstract: Foxconn's move into electric vehicle industry.
  • Theme: Foxconn's strategic shift towards electric vehicles amidst changing market dynamics.
  • Viewpoint: Foxconn's commitment to innovation and adaptation in response to technological advancements and evolving consumer preferences.
  • Main information: Establishment of a new car venture in Zhengzhou; diversification of product portfolio to include car components, motors, and NEVs; plans for car component manufacturing, motor production, and NEV sales; investment in a new plant in India.

总结：

富士康看到了新能源汽车（NEV）行业的潜力，成立了一家名为富士康新能源汽车产业发展（河南）有限公司的新业务企业。这家公司位于中国的郑州市，将专注于汽车零部件制造、电机生产和新能源汽车销售。富士康的目标是利用其在电子产品方面的专业知识，抓住汽车领域的增长机会，因为智能手机和消费电子产品需求的下降。
  • 摘要：富士康进军电动汽车行业。
  • 主题：富士康在市场动态变化的情况下战略性地向电动汽车转型。
  • 观点：富士康致力于创新和适应，以应对技术进步和不断变化的消费者偏好。
  • 主要信息：在郑州成立一家新的汽车合资企业；产品组合多元化，包括汽车零部件、电机和新能源汽车；计划生产汽车零部件、生产电机和销售新能源汽车；在印度投资建设新工厂。

单词：

  • new energy vehicle (NEV) - 新能源汽车。

    原文例句：The new project will involve car component manufacturing and development, motor production and NEV sales.

    例句讲解：“new energy vehicle”是一个复合名词，由“new”，“energy”和“vehicle”组成，意思是“新能源汽车”。

  • contract electronics manufacturer - 电子产品代工商。

    原文例句：The world’s largest contract electronics manufacturer is accelerating its move into the automobile industry amid weakening demand for smartphones and consumer gadgets.

    例句讲解：“contract electronics manufacturer”是一个复合名词，由“contract”，“electronics”和“manufacturer”组成，意思是“电子产品代工商”。

  • supply chain - 供应链。

    原文例句：The firm and other Apple suppliers move to diversify their supply chain.

    例句讲解：“supply chain”是一个复合名词，由“supply”和“chain”组成，意思是“供应链”。

词组：

  • move into - 进入

    原文例句：The world’s largest contract electronics manufacturer is accelerating its move into the automobile industry amid weakening demand for smartphones and consumer gadgets.

    例句讲解：“move into”是一个动词词组，意思是“进入”。

  • put under investigation - 接受调查

    原文例句：The company, which was put under a tax and land use investigation in October by mainland authorities, employs 200,000 workers in its Zhengzhou manufacturing complex.

    例句讲解：“put under investigation”是一个动词词组，意思是“接受调查”。

句子：

  • Foxconn Technology Group has set up a new car venture in Zhengzhou city, capital of central China’s Henan province and home to the world’s largest iPhone factory, as the Apple supplier steps up its efforts in the new energy vehicle (NEV) sector amid declining smartphone sales. - 富士康科技集团在河南省省会郑州市成立了一家新的汽车合资企业，该公司是全球最大的 iPhone 工厂所在地，随着苹果供应商在新能源汽车 (NEV) 领域的努力加剧，智能手机销售额下降。

    • 句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Foxconn Technology Group has set up a new car venture in Zhengzhou city，其中主语是Foxconn Technology Group，谓语是has set up，宾语是a new car venture in Zhengzhou city。从句as the Apple supplier steps up its efforts in the new energy vehicle (NEV) sector amid declining smartphone sales是一个定语从句，修饰主语Foxconn Technology Group，表示随着苹果供应商在新能源汽车 (NEV) 领域的努力加剧，智能手机销售额下降。

语法：

  • 现在进行时 - 表示现在正在进行的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Foxconn Technology Group has set up a new car venture in Zhengzhou city.

    语法讲解：现在进行时态是由be动词的现在时态加上动词的-ing形式构成的，表示现在正在进行的动作或状态。在这个例句中，has set up是一个现在进行时态的动词，表示富士康科技集团正在郑州市成立一家新的汽车合资企业。

  • 一般现在时 - 表示经常发生或一直存在的情况或状态。

    原文例句：The new project will involve car component manufacturing and development, motor production and NEV sales.

    语法讲解：一般现在时态是由be动词的现在时态加上动词的原形构成的，表示经常发生或一直存在的情况或状态。在这个例句中，will involve是一个一般现在时态的动词，表示新的项目将涉及汽车零部件制造和开发、电机生产和新能源汽车销售。

  • The Apple supplier has set up a new venture in Zhengzhou to sharpen its focus on the electric vehicle industry
  • The new project will involve car component manufacturing and development, motor production and car sales

Foxconn Technology Group has set up a new car venture in Zhengzhou city, capital of central China’s Henan province and home to the world’s largest iPhone factory, as the Apple supplier steps up its efforts in the new energy vehicle (NEV) sector amid declining smartphone sales.

The new firm, named Foxconn New Energy Automobile Industry Development (Henan) Co, was established on January 4 with a registered capital of 500 million yuan (US$70 million), according to public records in the National Enterprise Credit Information Publicity System.

Its business covers car component manufacturing and development, motor production and NEV sales, among other areas.

Foxconn, known formally as Hon Hai Precision Industry, said the new venture belongs to Foxconn Innovation Industry Development Group Co and aims to sharpen the company’s focus on the electric vehicle industry, according to a report by the Securities Times on Tuesday.

Foxconn confirmed the report, adding that the Henan subsidiary was disclosed in December 2023 to the Taiwan Stock Exchange.

The world’s largest contract electronics manufacturer is accelerating its move into the automobile industry amid weakening demand for smartphones and consumer gadgets.

The Taiwanese giant last week reported US$198.9 billion in preliminary revenue for 2023, down 7 per cent from 2022. It blamed slow market demand for its static consumer electronics product business in the fourth quarter, while expecting continuing decline in the first quarter of this year.

In October, Foxconn announced a new electric cargo van called Model N and announced plans to mass produce its compact SUV Model B. Jun Seki, its chief strategy officer for electric vehicles, said the company was in touch with about 14 potential customers and saw India and Japan as promising countries for EV development.

To help push the company towards its new direction, Foxconn opened a new global business base in Zhengzhou last April and reaffirmed its commitment to the Chinese market, even as the firm and other Apple suppliers move to diversify their supply chain.

Foxconn plans to start building new factories for smartphones and electronics goods in the cities of Zhoukou, Kaifeng and Jiyuan in Henan, according to a list of major construction projects in 2024 released last week by the provincial Development and Reform Commission.

The company, which was put under a tax and land use investigation in October by mainland authorities, employs 200,000 workers in its Zhengzhou manufacturing complex.

In 2022, that facility was rocked by violent workers’ protests and an exodus of tens of thousands of employees that Apple CEO Tim Cook later blamed for a decline in the US company’s quarterly revenue.

Separately, Foxconn plans to invest at least US$2.6 billion in a plant it is building in India to make Apple products, according to a report by Bloomberg last month.

item.title: CES 2024: China EV maker Xpeng accepts pre-orders for flying car but notes urban use is far off
item.description:
Summary：

  • Abstract: Xpeng unveils flying car prototypes at CES, aiming for initial deliveries in 2025, regardless of regulatory approvals.
  • Theme: Xpeng's entry into the flying car market, showcasing modular designs, and targeting a consumer base.
  • Viewpoint: Xpeng's distinction from competitors, focusing on consumer appeal and gradual integration into urban transportation.
  • Main information: Unveiling of the Land Aircraft Carrier and eVTOL car at CES; pre-orders and deliveries timeline; discussions with Chinese regulators; targeting non-urban areas due to regulatory constraints; pricing expectations similar to luxury performance cars.

总结：

  • 摘要：小鹏汽车在 CES 上发布两款飞行汽车，计划在2025年第四季度前交付首批产品，而不管法规是否齐备。
  • 主题：小鹏汽车进军飞行汽车市场，展示模块化设计，瞄准消费市场。
  • 观点：小鹏汽车与竞争对手的区别，专注于消费者吸引力和逐步融入城市交通。
  • 主要信息：在 CES 上发布陆地飞机和 eVTOL 汽车；预订和交付时间线；与中国监管机构的讨论；由于监管限制，瞄准非城市地区；定价预期与豪华性能汽车相似。

单词：

  • drone (n.) - 无人机。

    原文例句：Chinese electric vehicle maker Xpeng entered the market with its own “flying car”, with the goal of delivering the first batch by the fourth quarter of 2025, whether regulations are ready or not.

    例句讲解：这是一个由French单词drones（雄蜂）演变而来的英语单词，表示“无人机”。在这个例句中，它指的是小鹏汽车推出的“飞行汽车”，其目标是在2025年第四季度前交付首批产品，而不管法规是否齐备。

  • visual (adj.) - 视觉的。

    原文例句：The latest version of AeroHT’s eVTOL car has smaller wings, more propellers and a whole new visual identity, with a sportier design and upgraded technology.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin单词visus（看见），表示“视觉的”。在这个例句中，它描述了 AeroHT 最新款 eVTOL 汽车外观上的变化，包括更小的机翼、更多的螺旋桨以及更加动感的设计和升级的技术。

词组：

  • make a splash - 引起轰动，造成轰动。

    原文例句：EHang made a splash when it debuted the EHang 184 at CES in 2016.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由make（做，制造）和splash（溅起水花，造成轰动）构成的，表示“引起轰动，造成轰动”。在这个例句中，它描述了亿航在2016年CES上首次推出EHang 184时引起轰动。

  • target ... for ... - 把……作为……的目标。

    原文例句：The company, which made its debut at CES two years after EHang with its first car, noted that EHang’s products are just aerial vehicles without the ability to be driven on roads.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由target（目标）和for（为了，针对）构成的，表示“把……作为……的目标”。在这个例句中，它表示该公司注意到亿航的产品只是空中交通工具，无法在道路上行驶。

句子：

  • This will presumably make it more appealing for people to buy, whenever it becomes available, even if they cannot fly it to work every morning. - 这可能会让它变得更吸引人购买，只要它变得可用，即使他们不能每天早上开着它去工作。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是This will make it more appealing for people to buy，其中主语是This，谓语是will make，宾语是it。presumbly是一个副词，表示“大概，据推测”。whenever it becomes available是一个时间状语，表示“只要它变得可用”。even if they cannot fly it to work every morning是一个让步状语，表示“即使他们不能每天早上开着它去工作”。这个句子的意思是说，这可能会让它变得更吸引人购买，只要它变得可用，即使他们不能每天早上开着它去工作。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Gu said the company is already in talks with regulators in China but international expansion “takes time”.

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的延续性和完成性。在这个例句中，它表示顾说该公司已经与中国监管机构进行了会谈，但国际扩张“需要时间”。

  • 将来时 - 表示将来要发生的动作或状态。

    原文例句：This will presumably make it more appealing for people to buy, whenever it becomes available.

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：will/shall + 动词原形。其中will一般用于第一人称和第三人称，shall一般用于第二人称。这种时态表示将来要发生的动作或状态，强调动作或状态的必然性和确定性。在这个例句中，它表示这可能会让它变得更吸引人购买，只要它变得可用。

  • The company’s subsidiary AeroHT presented two types of flying cars at CES, including a sportier eVTOL that made its international debut
  • Xpeng president Brian Gu said the company is in talks with regulators in China to allow use of the vehicle, but international expansion ‘takes time’

Seven years after EHang debuted its first passenger drone, Chinese electric vehicle maker Xpeng entered the market with its own “flying car”, with the goal of delivering the first batch by the fourth quarter of 2025, whether regulations are ready or not.

The company’s subsidiary AeroHT presented two types of flying cars at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on Tuesday. Its modular Land Aircraft Carrier will start taking pre-orders in the fourth quarter this year, with deliveries to start a year later. The sportier AeroHT eVTOL (electric vertical take-off and landing) car made its international debut at the show, having previously conducted flying tests in China.

There is no information on pricing or availability for the AeroHT, which has propellers that pop out of the back. It has been demoed for flying in China, but it did not take flight at CES. Brian Gu Hongdi, vice-chairman and president of Xpeng, suggested it could launch before regulations are in place for city use, but that people could eventually buy one and fly it in areas where the use of aircraft is not regulated.

Hisense and TCL push AI in TVs, chase industry trends like smart cars

“The design of our vehicles is not targeted for urban transportation … [which] requires an extensive regulatory approval process,” Gu said. “That’s why we’re targeting a consumer market, for people to first enjoy the experience of flying and then obviously with the regulatory framework in place, we gradually can move towards urban transportation.”

While Gu said it was too early to say what pricing might be, he expects it to be “similar to buying a luxury performance car”.

Similar products have been in the works for years. EHang made a splash when it debuted the EHang 184 at CES in 2016. In the years since, it has invited journalists to take rides and went public on the Nasdaq.

Xpeng distanced itself from the EHang comparison, saying its products are different and target different buyers. The EV company, which made its debut at CES two years after EHang with its first car, noted that EHang’s products are just aerial vehicles without the ability to be driven on roads. EHang is also targeting enterprise use, while Xpeng is targeting a wider consumer base.

“We are targeting the consumer market, which is very different,” Gu said. “I don’t see another company that’s doing that right now.”

While Xpeng has also highlighted how the Land Aircraft Carrier could be used for public services like emergency rescue, the new eVTOL car is a more stylish option that can conceal its rotors. This will presumably make it more appealing for people to buy, whenever it becomes available, even if they cannot fly it to work every morning.

AI to dominate CES 2024, with glasses for blind, shoes to walk faster

Gu said the company is already in talks with regulators in China but international expansion “takes time”.

Xpeng’s ambitions could face some challenges with current geopolitical tensions, though. Chinese drone tech has been caught in the cross hairs before. Washington put DJI, the world’s largest consumer drone maker, on its Entity List that bars US companies from doing business with it without express approval.

When asked whether this could present some hurdles, Gu said, “I’m not even thinking about that right now … This business is purely focused on the China market right now.”

item.title: TSMC halts revenue drop, beats expectations on brisk demand for AI chips from Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices
item.description:
Summary：

Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC), the world's largest contract chipmaker, reported a 4.5% decline in revenue to NT$2.16 trillion last year despite beating analyst expectations and reaching record quarterly revenue of NT$625.5 billion. However, the company's US$20.2 billion earnings for the fourth quarter fell short of growth targets, with December sales decreasing by 8.4% year-over-year due to sluggish smartphone and laptop chip sales.
  • Abstract: TSMC's revenue declined overall, but the company saw strong demand for AI chips and expects growth in 2024.
  • Theme: Despite facing challenges in the consumer electronics industry, TSMC remains optimistic about its growth prospects due to the rising demand for AI chips.
  • Viewpoint: TSMC's leadership is confident in the company's ability to capitalize on the growing demand for AI chips.
  • Main information: TSMC's quarterly revenue beat estimates, but annual revenue declined due to weak consumer demand; the company expects growth in 2024 driven by AI chip demand; Apple's iPhone sales have been affected by headwinds in China.

总结：

全球最大的芯片代工厂台积电去年收入下降 4.5%，至 2.16 万亿新台币，尽管如此，该公司还是超出了分析师的预期，第四季度营收达到 6255 亿新台币的创纪录水平。然而，由于智能手机和笔记本电脑芯片销售低迷，该公司第四季度的 202 亿美元收益未能实现增长目标，12 月份的销售额较去年同期下降 8.4%。
  • 摘要：台积电收入总体下降，但该公司看到 AI 芯片的强劲需求，并预计 2024 年将增长。
  • 主题：尽管面临消费电子行业挑战，但台积电对增长前景依然乐观，因 AI 芯片需求不断增长。
  • 观点：台积电领导层对公司利用不断增长的 AI 芯片需求的能力充满信心。
  • 主要信息：台积电的季度收入超出预期，但由于消费需求疲软，全年收入却出现下降；该公司预计 2024 年将在 AI 芯片需求的推动下实现增长；苹果 iPhone 销售受到中国市场逆风的影响。

单词：

  • revenue (n.) - /ˈrev(ə)njuː/ 收入，收益。

    原文例句：Overall revenue declined 4.5 per cent last year, to NT$2.16 trillion.

    例句讲解：Revenue 是一个常用词，意思是收入，收益。它来自法语 revenu，意思是“归还，回报”。在这个例句中，它指的是台积电在去年的总收入。

  • quarterly (adj.) - /ˈkwɔːtəli/ 季度的，每季度的。

    原文例句：TSMC’s US$20.2 billion quarter still fell short of delivering growth.

    例句讲解：Quarterly 是一个形容词，意思是季度的，每季度的。它来自拉丁语 quartus，意思是“第四”。在这个例句中，它指的是台积电的第四季度收益。

词组：

  • fall short of - 未达到，不能满足。

    原文例句：While it outdid analyst expectations and its own guidance, TSMC’s US$20.2 billion quarter still fell short of delivering growth.

    例句讲解：Fall short of 是一个动词短语，意思是未达到，不能满足。它来自 fall（跌落，下降）和 short of（不足）。在这个例句中，它指的是台积电第四季度的收益虽然超出了分析师的预期和公司的指导，但仍然未能实现增长。

句子：

  • Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC), the world's largest contract chip maker, saw its fourth-quarter revenue beat estimates of a decline, as demand from artificial intelligence (AI) players helped offset sluggish smartphone and laptop chip sales. - 台积电是全球最大的芯片代工厂，该公司第四季度营收超过了预期，因为来自人工智能 (AI) 参与者的需求帮助抵消了智能手机和笔记本电脑芯片销售的低迷。

    句子分析：这是一个长句，主句是TSMC saw its fourth-quarter revenue beat estimates of a decline，其中主语是TSMC，谓语是saw，宾语是its fourth-quarter revenue beat estimates of a decline。as demand from artificial intelligence (AI) players helped offset sluggish smartphone and laptop chip sales是一个as引导的状语从句，修饰主句，表示需求来自人工智能（AI）参与者的需求帮助抵消了智能手机和笔记本电脑芯片销售的低迷。这个句子的意思是说，台积电第四季度营收超过了预期，因为来自人工智能（AI）参与者的需求帮助抵消了智能手机和笔记本电脑芯片销售的低迷。

语法：

  • 分词短语 - 用作形容词或副词来修饰名词或动词。

    原文例句：The chip maker signalled the trough in demand had been reached in the summer and recovery would begin to take hold in the months leading up to 2024.

    语法讲解：这是一个分词短语，用作形容词来修饰名词trough。分词短语是由一个分词和它的修饰语组成的。在这个例句中，分词是signalled，它的修饰语是the trough in demand had been reached in the summer and recovery would begin to take hold in the months leading up to 2024。这个分词短语的意思是需求的低谷在夏季已经达到，复苏将在导致2024年的几个月内开始复苏。

  • 现在完成时 - 表示一个动作或状态在现在之前完成。

    原文例句：Apple, arguably TSMC’s most important customer, has faced headwinds with its latest iPhone generation in China, the world’s biggest smartphone market.

    语法讲解：这是一个现在完成时态的动词，表示一个动作或状态在现在之前完成。结构是：have/has + been + 过去分词。在这个例句中，have是助动词，been是过去分词，faced是现在分词。这个句子的意思是说，苹果作为台积电最重要客户，在其最新一代 iPhone 在中国这个全球最大的智能手机市场中，面临着逆风。

  • The Hsinchu-based company reported a NT$625.5 billion quarter, matching earnings from the same period a year earlier
  • While it outdid analyst expectations and its own guidance, TSMC’s US$20.2 billion quarter still fell short of delivering growth

Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC), the world's largest contract chip maker, saw its fourth-quarter revenue beat estimates of a decline, as demand from artificial intelligence (AI) players helped offset sluggish smartphone and laptop chip sales.

Hsinchu-based TSMC, the main chip supplier to Apple and Nvidia, reported December sales of NT$176.3 billion (US$5.7 billion), completing a NT$625.5 billion quarter.

That matched earnings from the same period a year earlier, which was among TSMC’s highest quarterly results. The average analyst estimate for sales over the last three months was NT$616.2 billion.

Over the course of 2023, TSMC moderated its capital expenditure plans as the consumer electronics industry grappled with a glut of unsold inventory. The chip maker signalled the trough in demand had been reached in the summer and recovery would begin to take hold in the months leading up to 2024.

Overall revenue declined 4.5 per cent last year, to NT$2.16 trillion.

While it outdid analyst expectations and its own guidance, TSMC’s US$20.2 billion quarter still fell short of delivering growth. December sales were down 8.4 per cent on the same month a year earlier, offering a mixed outlook for the year ahead.

Top management including chief executive CC Wei have said they expect overall business to grow this year, and the company has seen its high-performance computing business boosted by demand for AI chips from Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices.

Earlier in the week, fellow chip maker Samsung Electronics posted its sixth successive quarter of declining operating profit, as it weathered the impact of muted consumer demand in its smartphone and memory businesses.

Still, the latest report from the Semiconductor Industry Association showed the first growth in chip sales in over a year came in November, suggesting momentum is gathering for a resurgence in 2024.

China to persist with AI development in 2024 despite US chip curbs: UBS

Upgrades to AI server farms and on-device AI applications are likely to drive an information technology replacement cycle, according to HSBC analysts Ricky Seo and Hankil Chang.

“For US cloud service providers, we expect capex to grow significantly, about 65 per cent in 2024e. Additionally, AI server purchases will likely total 57 per cent of their investments in 2024e, up from 8 per cent in 2022,” they wrote in a research note on Wednesday.

Apple, arguably TSMC’s most important customer, has faced headwinds with its latest iPhone generation in China, the world’s biggest smartphone market. Several analysts have downgraded Apple this year on expectations of soft demand, and this week Jefferies said the iPhone sales slump in China is likely to deepen.

The US company has also been hit by an expanded ban by Chinese agencies and state-owned companies ordering staff to keep iPhones and other foreign devices away from work premises.

item.title: Amazon’s Twitch to cut 500 employees, or 35% of staff, as soon as January 10 as business remains unprofitable

  • Main information: Twitch's planned layoffs, the reasons behind the decision, and the company's focus on advertising and mending relations with video game streamers.

  • 摘要：Twitch计划裁员35%因亏损且多位高管离职。

    例句讲解：这个词组是由cross-country（全国范围的），charm（魅力），offensive（攻势）构成的，表示“全国范围的魅力攻势”。在这个例句中，它表示Clancy自2023年3月上任以来，一直在进行全国范围的魅力攻势，以修复与在Twitch上直播为生的视频游戏名人之间的关系。

句子：

  • Running a large-scale website supporting 1.8 billion hours of live video content a month is enormously expensive, company executives have said - 运营一个每月支持18亿小时直播视频内容的大型网站非常昂贵，公司高管们说。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Running a large-scale website supporting 1.8 billion hours of live video content a month is enormously expensive，其中主语是Running a large-scale website supporting 1.8 billion hours of live video content a month，谓语是is enormously expensive。company executives have said是一个现在完成时态的句子，表示公司高管们已经说过，这是一个非谓语动词短语作状语，表示这是公司高管们说过的。这个句子的意思是说，运营一个每月支持18亿小时直播视频内容的大型网站非常昂贵，公司高管们已经说过。

语法：

  • 冠词 - 表示名词的限定或修饰。

    原文例句：The cuts come after Twitch’s chief product officer, chief customer officer and chief content officer left in the final months of 2023

    语法讲解：冠词是置于名词或名词等价词前面，表示名词的限定或修饰的实词，是英语名词体系中的一个重要部分。冠词包括定冠词the和不定冠词a/an，还有零冠词。在英语中，名词前是否使用冠词以及使用哪一个冠词，要根据名词的具体情况和语境来决定。在这个例句中，the cuts come after Twitch’s chief product officer, chief customer officer and chief content officer left in the final months of 2023，冠词the表示Twitch的首席产品官、首席客户官和首席内容官在2023年底离职。

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Twitch has increased its focus on advertising in recent years.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，it has been increased its focus on advertising in recent years，表示Twitch近年来一直在增加对广告的关注，强调这种关注的持续性和未完成性。

  • The cuts come after Twitch’s chief product officer, chief customer officer and chief content officer left in the final months of 2023
  • Running a large-scale website supporting 1.8 billion hours of live video content a month is enormously expensive, company executives have said

Amazon.com’s live-streaming site Twitch is poised to cut 35 per cent of its staff, or about 500 workers, according to people familiar with the plans, the latest in a series of job reductions there.

The cuts, which could be announced as soon as Wednesday, come amid concerns over losses at Twitch and after several top executives left the company in the span of a few months. A Twitch representative declined to comment.

Running a large-scale website supporting 1.8 billion hours of live video content a month is enormously expensive, despite Twitch’s reliance on Amazon’s infrastructure, company executives have said.

In December, Twitch chief executive Dan Clancy said the company would cease operations in South Korea, where the costs are “prohibitively expensive”, according to a blog post he wrote.

Twitch has increased its focus on advertising in recent years. Nine years after Amazon’s acquisition of the company, the business remains unprofitable, according to the people, who asked not to be identified discussing private information.

In the final months of 2023, several top executives announced their departures, including Twitch’s chief product officer, chief customer officer and chief content officer. Twitch also lost its chief revenue officer, who worked on Twitch from within Amazon’s ads unit.

“It’s always bittersweet when talented leaders move on to pursue new opportunities,’’ a Twitch spokesman said at the time. “We are incredibly grateful for their contributions to Twitch and our community, and wish them all the best.”

The former employees all declined to comment.

Since he took the position in March 2023, Clancy has been on a cross-country charm offensive to mend relations with the video gaming celebrities who make a living streaming on Twitch.

Many of them chafed at Twitch’s original approach to ads, which the company reworked after criticism. Streamers have praised Clancy’s desire to listen to their concerns after years of complaints that the service was out of touch with its users.

The new chief has struggled to stem losses, however. Twitch undertook two rounds of lay-offs last year, cutting over 400 positions, part of wider job reductions at Amazon.

The online retail giant initiated its biggest-ever corporate job cuts in 2022, which it expanded to 27,000 positions across the company. It continued in October with a new round of cuts to its music division, which encompasses the company’s audio streaming platform and digital storefront for songs.

item.title: US SEC says its X account was compromised to falsely say bitcoin ETFs approved
item.description:
Summary：

  • 本周，美国证券交易委员会（SEC）的X账号被入侵，发布假消息，称SEC已经批准了比特币ETF，导致比特币价格短暂飙升。SEC已澄清该消息为假，并正在调查此事。

  • SEC主席加里·詹斯勒长期以来一直对加密货币持谨慎态度，此次黑客事件发生在SEC一再警告加密货币网络安全漏洞的背景下，引发业界讽刺。

  • SEC已表示将与执法部门合作调查此事件，并强调该虚假消息并非由SEC或其工作人员发布的。

  • SEC尚未批准任何比特币ETF，目前仍有大约十几家公司申请在美国上市以比特币为支撑的ETF，SEC需要在1月10日前采取行动。

  • SEC必须批准交易所列入ETF的19b-4申请，以及潜在发行人的S-1表格注册申请，才能开始交易以现货为支持的比特币ETF。

  • SEC本周将对交易所的19b-4申请进行投票，目前尚不清楚是否会同时对发行人的S-1申请采取行动。

  • SEC previously refused to allow such a product to launch, citing concerns about investor protection and the potential for market manipulation. However, speculation has been mounting since August, when the SEC lost a key legal fight against crypto asset manager Grayscale Investments, that the regulator will have to acquiesce to the growing clamour for the product.

总结：

  • 本周，美国证券交易委员会（SEC）的X账号被入侵，发布假消息，称SEC已经批准了比特币ETF，导致比特币价格短暂飙升。SEC已澄清该消息为假，并正在调查此事。

  • SEC主席加里·詹斯勒长期以来一直对加密货币持谨慎态度，此次黑客事件发生在SEC一再警告加密货币网络安全漏洞的背景下，引发业界讽刺。

  • SEC已表示将与执法部门合作调查此事件，并强调该虚假消息并非由SEC或其工作人员发布的。

  • SEC尚未批准任何比特币ETF，目前仍有大约十几家公司申请在美国上市以比特币为支撑的ETF，SEC需要在1月10日前采取行动。

  • SEC必须批准交易所列入ETF的19b-4申请，以及潜在发行人的S-1表格注册申请，才能开始交易以现货为支持的比特币ETF。

  • SEC本周将对交易所的19b-4申请进行投票，目前尚不清楚是否会同时对发行人的S-1申请采取行动。

  • SEC之前一直拒绝允许这种产品上市，理由是担心投资者保护和潜在的市场操纵。然而，自8月份SEC输掉针对加密资产管理公司Grayscale Investments的关键法律之战以来，人们猜测监管机构将不得不顺应对该产品的日益增长的呼声。

单词：

  • Anticipated (adj.) - 预期的，期待的。

    原文例句：The company's initial public offering (IPO) was highly anticipated.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由ante-（在……之前）和capere（采取）组成，意为“预期，期待”。在这个例句中，它描述了这家公司的首次公开募股（IPO）受到了高度期待。

  • Faithful (adj.) - 忠实的，忠诚的。

    原文例句：The company's most faithful customers have been with it for over 20 years.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Old French，意思是“忠实的，忠诚的”。在这个例句中，它描述了这家公司最忠实的顾客已经陪伴它超过20年了。

词组：

  • Take action - 采取行动。

    原文例句：The government needs to take action to address the problem of climate change.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由take（采取）和action（行动）构成的，表示“采取行动”。在这个例句中，它表示政府需要采取行动来解决气候变化问题。

  • As soon as - 一旦。

    原文例句：I'll call you as soon as I get there.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由as（像，作为）和soon as（尽快）构成的，表示“一旦”。在这个例句中，它表示我一旦到达那里就会给你打电话。

句子：

  • The SEC said that there was unapproved activity on the @SECGov X account “by an unknown party for a brief period of time shortly after 4pm ET” on Tuesday. - SEC表示，周二下午4点美国东部时间后不久，@SECGov X账户在“一段短暂时间内”出现了未经授权的活动。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是SEC said that there was unapproved activity on the @SECGov X account，其中主语是SEC，谓语是said，宾语是there was unapproved activity on the @SECGov X account。said是say的过去式，表示“说”。by an unknown party for a brief period of time shortly after 4pm ET是一个介词短语作状语，表示这一活动是由一个未知的参与者在周二下午4点美国东部时间后不久进行的。

语法：

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由句子主语以外的某个主体做出的。

    原文例句：Twitter banned the president from its platform.

    语法讲解：这是一个被动句，主语是president，谓语是被动语态的banned，其中be是助动词，banned是过去分词。表示总统被推特平台封杀了。

  • US authorities are investigating how the @SECGov’s account was compromised by ‘an unknown party’
  • The regulator has clarified that no decision on spot bitcoin ETFs had been made

A highly anticipated decision by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on whether to approve a spot-bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) quickly morphed into a major cybersecurity incident on Tuesday.

The SEC’s X account was compromised and a fake post claiming that the agency had greenlit plans for the products fuelled a brief surge in the price of the world’s biggest cryptocurrency. It also has sparked an investigation by US authorities into how a social media account at Wall Street’s main regulator was compromised.

“It really shows the breadth and frequency of cyberattacks,” said Kurt Gottschall, a partner at law firm Haynes Boone and former SEC regional director. “The irony here is that the SEC has not shown much sympathy to public companies and asset managers that have experienced cybersecurity incidents.”

The breach gave fodder to crypto faithful who have long viewed the commission’s chairman, Gary Gensler, as an enemy due to his zeal to rein in the industry.

The irony of a cybersecurity incident befalling a regulator that has repeatedly warned of crypto’s online vulnerabilities was not lost on critics who have spent years waiting for the SEC to approve a bitcoin ETF. Traders have been speculating for weeks that the agency could approve several of the products as soon as Wednesday.

In statements late on Tuesday, the regulator said that it would work with law enforcement to investigate the incident, the unauthorised access had been terminated, and that the post was not made by the SEC or its staff. In a separate statement, Gensler clarified that no decision on ETFs had been made.

The SEC said that there was unapproved activity on the @SECGov X account “by an unknown party for a brief period of time shortly after 4pm ET” on Tuesday. After the fake post was removed, Joe Benarroch, head of business operations at X, said in a statement that the “account is secure and we are investigating the root cause”.

About a dozen companies have applied to list ETFs backed by bitcoin in the US. The SEC has until January 10 to take action on at least one of those applications, and crypto insiders have speculated the regulator will use that date to announce a slew of decisions at once.

There are two technical requirements that must be fulfilled before a spot-backed bitcoin ETF can start trading. First, the SEC must sign off on so-called 19b-4 filings by the exchanges that would list the ETFs. Second, the regulator must approve the relevant S-1 forms, which are the registration applications from the would-be issuers – a list that includes BlackRock and Fidelity.

The SEC is planning to vote on the exchanges’ filings, the 19b-4s, this week, Bloomberg News has reported. The regulator may or may not take action on the issuers’ applications, the S-1s, around the same time. If the SEC grants both sets of required approvals, the ETFs could start trading as soon as the next business day.

The SEC under Gensler and his Trump-era predecessor, Jay Clayton, has previously refused to allow such a product to launch, citing concerns about investor protection and the potential for market manipulation. However, speculation has been mounting since August, when the SEC lost a key legal fight against crypto asset manager Grayscale Investments, that the regulator will have to acquiesce to the growing clamour for the product.

Hype about an approval has been rampant on social media. Bitcoin surged as much as 10 per cent on October 16 when a crypto news site incorrectly posted on X that BlackRock had been approved to list a spot ETF. About US$85 million of mostly bearish trading positions were liquidated during the surge, which quickly reversed.

item.title: China to persist with AI development in 2024 despite rigid US chip restrictions, UBS analysts say
item.description:
English summary：

China will strive to progress in AI by utilizing domestic AI accelerator programs and making efficient use of computing resources, despite export controls imposed by the US restricting access to advanced semiconductors.
  • Abstract: China's determination to advance artificial intelligence (AI), such as large language models (LLMs) and generative AI systems, amid US restrictions on advanced semiconductors.
  • Theme: China's strategies for overcoming challenges and making advancements in AI, aiming for self-sufficiency and innovation.
  • Viewpoint: The significance of domestic AI programs and optimizing resource utilization in mitigating the impact of US sanctions on China's semiconductor industry.
  • Main information: Nicolas Gaudois, head of Asia-Pacific technology research at UBS, expects China to work within export control constraints and leverage domestic AI accelerators. China's focus on certain unsanctioned semiconductor segments shows market growth. Demand for chips is likely to increase with easing inventory pressures.

中文总结：

中国将在人工智能领域持续进步，利用国内人工智能加速计划和提高计算资源效率，尽管美国出口管制限制了获得先进半导体。
  • 摘要：中国在人工智能领域取得进步的决心，例如大型语言模型（LLM）和生成式人工智能（AI）系统，同时受到美国对先进半导体的限制。
  • 主题：中国克服挑战和在人工智能领域取得进步的战略，以实现自给自足和创新。
  • 观点：国内人工智能计划和优化资源利用在减轻美国制裁对中国半导体产业影响中的重要性。
  • 主要信息：瑞银亚太科技研究主管尼古拉斯·高杜伊斯预计，中国将在出口管制约束下努力，并利用国内人工智能加速器。中国专注于某些未受制裁的半导体领域，展现出市场增长。随着库存压力缓解，对芯片的需求可能会增加。

单词：

  • overcome (v.) - /ˌoʊvərˈkʌm/ 克服，克服困难。

    原文例句：Nicolas Gaudois, head of Asia-Pacific technology research at UBS, expects China to work within export control constraints and leverage domestic AI accelerators.

    例句讲解：“克服”是指战胜或克服障碍或困难。在这个例句中，Nicolas Gaudois 预计中国将在出口管制约束下努力，并利用国内人工智能加速器。这表明中国将努力克服出口管制带来的挑战，并利用国内资源来发展人工智能。

  • semiconductor (n.) - /ˌsemɪkənˈdʌktər/ 半导体。

    原文例句：China will press ahead this year with development of large language models (LLMs) – the technology used to train ChatGPT and similar applications – and generative artificial intelligence (AI) systems, despite restrictions imposed by the United States on the mainland’s access to advanced semiconductors.

    例句讲解：半导体是一种具有导电性和绝缘性之间电导率的材料，广泛用于电子设备中。在这个例句中，“半导体”是指中国在发展大型语言模型和生成式人工智能系统时，受到美国对先进半导体的限制所面临的挑战。

词组：

  • within those constraints - 在那些限制内。

    原文例句：China is expected to “work within those constraints and try to make progress” by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources, said Nicolas Gaudois.

    例句讲解：“在那些限制内”是指在规定的条件或限制下。在这个例句中，Nicolas Gaudois 表示中国预计将在那些限制内努力，并利用国内人工智能加速器和更经济地使用计算资源来取得进展。这表明中国将努力在出口管制限制的条件下克服挑战，并利用国内资源来发展人工智能。

句子：

  • UBS analysts asserted that China’s semiconductor sector has developed well in certain unsanctioned segments, showing strong market growth over the past few years. - 瑞银分析师断言，中国半导体行业在某些未受制裁的领域发展良好，过去几年表现出强劲的市场增长。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是China’s semiconductor sector has developed well，其中主语是China’s semiconductor sector，谓语是has developed well。in certain unsanctioned segments是一个介词短语作状语，表示在中国某些未受制裁的领域。showing strong market growth over the past few years是一个现在分词短语作状语，表示了过去几年表现出强劲的市场增长。这个句子的意思是说，中国半导体行业在某些未受制裁的领域发展良好，过去几年表现出强劲的市场增长。

语法：

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由主语以外的人或物引起的。

    原文例句：A slew of sanctions imposed by the US since 2019 has forced companies across China’s vast tech supply chain to work closely together in supporting domestic artificial intelligence projects.

    语法讲解：这是一个被动语态的句子，主语是companies，谓语是被动语态动词has forced，宾语是to work closely together in supporting domestic artificial intelligence projects。这个句子的意思是说，自 2019 年以来，美国实施的一系列制裁迫使中国庞大的技术供应链中的公司紧密合作，以支持国内人工智能项目。

  • China is expected to ‘work within those constraints’ while making progress via AI accelerators and more economical use of computing resources
  • The country’s ability to overcome setbacks caused by US exports controls must not be underestimated, according to UBS’ Nicolas Gaudois

China will press ahead this year with development of large language models (LLMs) – the technology used to train ChatGPT and similar applications – and generative artificial intelligence (AI) systems, despite restrictions imposed by the United States on the mainland’s access to advanced semiconductors, according to analysts from Swiss investment bank UBS.

China is expected to “work within those constraints and try to make progress” by tapping into domestic AI accelerator programmes and being more economical in using computing resources, said Nicolas Gaudois, head of Asia-Pacific technology research at UBS, during a webinar hosted by the bank on Tuesday.

Gaudois said US export controls have blocked China’s access to Nvidia chips used for AI projects, but indicated that the mainland’s ability to overcome such setbacks must not be underestimated.

The views expressed by UBS analysts reflect how China’s semiconductor industry weathered last year’s escalation of Washington’s tech sanctions, which restricted exports of advanced chip-making equipment and cutting-edge semiconductors for AI projects.

The mainland’s tech sector appeared to have overcome the chokehold of US export controls last year, when Huawei Technologies made a surprise return to the 5G smartphone market with new handsets powered by a “breakthrough” advanced made-in-China processor.

It showed the lengths taken by the US-blacklisted company to build up its operations, following years of struggles on account of trade sanctions.

Apart from that breakthrough, UBS analysts asserted that China’s semiconductor sector has developed well in certain unsanctioned segments, showing strong market growth over the past few years.

“Restrictions from the US are very limited on mature nodes,” said Randy Abrams, head of Taiwan Research at UBS, in the same webinar on Tuesday. He pointed out that sales of these mature-node chips have not been restricted.

“We have seen China make more effort to invest in those areas,” Abrams said. “We will see steady market pickup in mature applications, such as camera image sensors, micro-controllers, analogue chips and discrete semiconductor devices for EVs.”

China’s semiconductor industry weathers tough year amid tighter US sanctions

“In semiconductor equipment, local suppliers have built up their market share from very low single-digits into the mid- to high-single-digits,” he said. “Their gains come from supplying China semiconductor manufacturers, as they’ve added mature node capacity.”

Abrams said domestic chip-making equipment suppliers saw their market share increase to about 20 per cent on the back of demand from Chinese chip fabrication facilities. “So if we leave out the very advanced nodes, there are actually a lot of [investment] opportunities,” he said.

Global demand for chips, he said, is expected to start picking up, as soon as inventory pressures ease and procurement at semiconductor foundries improves.

A slew of sanctions imposed by the US since 2019 has also forced companies across China’s vast tech supply chain to work closely together.

Internet search giant Baidu, which runs Ernie Bot and the Ernie LLM, ordered US$61 million worth of Huawei’s 910B Ascend AI chips – which the Chinese firm developed as an alternative to Nvidia’s A100 processor – for 200 servers, according to a report in November by Reuters, which cited sources.

item.title: Alibaba’s DingTalk updates workplace collaboration app with new AI agent amid growing client demand
item.description:
English summary：

Alibaba's DingTalk app launches an AI agent feature, powered by its Tongyi Qianwen large language model (LLM), to assist users in streamlining and personalizing their workflow. This move comes amidst the surge of AI integration in the industry, following similar initiatives by ByteDance's Feishu.
  • Abstract: DingTalk's AI agent aims to enhance workplace collaboration and productivity by responding to user feedback and incorporating AI-generated content.
  • Theme: Alibaba's DingTalk introduces an AI agent to improve user experience and workflow customization.
  • Viewpoint: The significance of AI agents in facilitating AI integration in the workplace; the growing trend of incorporating AI capabilities into business applications.
  • Main information: DingTalk's AI agent feature announcement at a corporate event in Hangzhou; the potential of AI agents as a gateway for AI applications; the growth of DingTalk's user base and organizations using its platform.

阿里巴巴旗下钉钉应用推出人工智能（AI）座席功能，由其统一前沿大语言模型（LLM）提供支持，旨在帮助用户简化并自定义工作流程。此举正值行业内AI集成激增之际，紧随字节跳动飞书的类似举措之后。

  • 主题：阿里巴巴钉钉推出AI座席，以提升用户体验和工作流程定制化。

单词：

  • streamline (v.) - /ˈstriːmlaɪn/ 简化，理顺。

  • customise (v.) - /ˈkʌstəmaɪz/ 定制，自定义。

  • take the world by storm - 惊呆全世界。

    原文例句：LLMs are the deep learning models, pre-trained on vast amounts of data, that underpin chatbots such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT, which took the world by storm a year ago with its ability to understand complex questions and respond with human-like text.

    例句讲解：这个短语是一个动宾短语，表示“惊呆全世界”。在这个例句中，它表示LLM是经过大量数据预训练的深度学习模型，是OpenAI的ChatGPT等聊天机器人的基础，ChatGPT一年前凭借其理解复杂问题并以类似人类的文本做出回应的能力震惊了世界。

句子：

  • The AI agent feature announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou, capital of eastern Zhejiang province, is designed to address feedback gleaned from more than 700,000 corporate clients, said Ye Jun, president of DingTalk, in a statement. - 钉钉总裁叶军在一份声明中表示，在浙江省东部省会杭州举行的一次企业活动中，与钉钉7.5一同宣布的AI座席功能旨在解决从超过70万公司客户收集到的反馈。

    句子分析：这是一个主谓宾结构的句子，主语是The AI agent feature，谓语是is designed to address，宾语是feedback。announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou, capital of eastern Zhejiang province,是一个过去分词短语，作定语，修饰The AI agent feature，表示AI座席功能与钉钉7.5一起在杭州举行的企业活动中宣布。said Ye Jun, president of DingTalk, in a statement是一个插入语，表示这些话是钉钉总裁叶军在一份声明中说的。more than 700,000 corporate clients是一个介词结构，作定语，修饰feedback，表示超过70万公司客户。这个句子的意思是说，在浙江省东部省会杭州举行的一次企业活动中，与钉钉7.5一起宣布的AI座席功能旨在解决从超过70万公司客户收集到的反馈。

  • The new tool is expected to promote greater adoption of AI products in the industry, according to the company. - 该公司表示，新工具有望促进AI产品在行业中的更大采用。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：As of the end of 2023, Dingtalk had over 700 million users.

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，it表示截止2023年底，钉钉拥有超过7亿用户。

  • 虚拟语气 - 表示对虚拟情况的描述。

    原文例句：DingTalk’s addition of an AI agent function, powered by the group’s Tongyi Qianwen large language model (LLM), comes after ByteDance’s Feishu made a similar push last November.

    语法讲解

    • DingTalk’s AI agent function is powered by Alibaba’sTongyi Qianwen large language model
    • The AI agent feature was announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou

    Alibaba Group Holding’s DingTalk launched an updated version of its workplace collaboration app on Tuesday with the addition of an artificial intelligence (AI) agent function to help users streamline and customise their workflow.

    The development comes amid a flurry of activity in the AI sector as Chinese companies rush to incorporate ChatGPT-like services into their products and after a similar move by ByteDance’s rival app Feishu. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

    The AI agent feature announced alongside DingTalk 7.5 at a corporate event held in Hangzhou, capital of eastern Zhejiang province, is designed to address feedback gleaned from more than 700,000 corporate clients, said Ye Jun, president of DingTalk, in a statement.

    The new tool is expected to promote greater adoption of AI products in the industry, according to the company.

    “As the tide of AI-generated content increasingly finds its way into productivity and [business] use cases, AI agents have emerged as the most suitable gateway for AI applications,” said Ye.

    ByteDance brings AI to office tool Feishu, taking on Tencent and Alibaba

    Ye added that DingTalk’s goal is to become an AI agent platform with low entry barriers, with the marketplace expected to grow substantially in the next three years.

    As of the end of 2023, Dingtalk had over 700 million users. It also has 25 million organisations, including corporate and educational institutions that use its platform, of which 120,000 are paying clients, said Ye.

    Shoes and apparel giant Belle International has rolled out a customised AI agent on its DingTalk platform to track parcel shipment issues, with plans to expand the use of the agent to more cases, including stock allocation.

    DingTalk’s addition of an AI agent function, powered by the group’s Tongyi Qianwen large language model (LLM), comes after ByteDance’s Feishu made a similar push last November.

    LLMs are the deep learning models, pre-trained on vast amounts of data, that underpin chatbots such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT, which took the world by storm a year ago with its ability to understand complex questions and respond with human-like text.

    At the launch of Feishu 7, ByteDance introduced an AI bot dubbed Feishu Intelligent Buddy, which can help users with daily tasks such as drafting emails, drawing up spreadsheets and summarising long reports.

    Feishu also announced a platform to enable its corporate clients to build and customise AI bots according to business needs, it said at the time.

    After a year of hype over AI chatbots, Chinese Big Tech firms including Alibaba, ByteDance and Baidu have been rushing to build competitor products to ChatGPT, with applications spanning the finance, legal, manufacturing, retail and public sectors.

item.title: Alibaba’s logistics arm Cainiao offers shoppers in US grouped delivery service, cutting shipping times to five days
item.description:
Summary：

Cainiao, the logistics arm of Alibaba Group, is launching a new service for Chinese consumers in the US, allowing them to consolidate multiple online shopping orders into a single shipment, reducing delivery times to as little as five days via air or cutting costs to as low as 12 yuan (US$1.7) via sea. The service, called "consolidated shipping", aims to cater to the growing number of Chinese consumers in the US who frequently purchase goods from Chinese e-commerce sites. Cainiao plans to raise at least US$1 billion through an IPO in Hong Kong, leveraging its strong track record of cross-border e-commerce parcel deliveries and its position as a major logistics services provider.
  • Abstract: Cainiao launches consolidated shipping service for Chinese consumers in the US, aiming to streamline cross-border e-commerce deliveries.
  • Theme: Cainiao's expansion into the US market to meet the needs of Chinese consumers and students for efficient and affordable cross-border shipping.
  • Viewpoint: The growing demand for consolidated shipping services among Chinese consumers overseas, particularly in the US.
  • Main information: Details of the consolidated shipping service, including delivery times, cost savings, and supported transport routes; Cainiao's plans for a US$1 billion IPO in Hong Kong; Cainiao's role as Alibaba's logistics backbone and its track record in cross-border e-commerce.

总结：

菜鸟，阿里巴巴集团的物流部门，正在为美国中国消费者推出新服务，让他们可以将多笔在线购物订单合并成一单运输，将空运的送货时间缩短至五天，或将海运的成本降低到 12 元人民币（1.7 美元）。这项名为“集运服务”的服务旨在满足在美国越来越多的中国消费者的需求，他们经常从中国电子商务网站上购买商品。菜鸟计划通过在香港进行首次公开募股筹集至少 10 亿美元，依靠其在跨境电子商务包裹递送方面的良好记录和其作为主要物流服务提供商的地位。
  • 摘要：菜鸟为美国中国消费者推出集运服务，旨在简化跨境电子商务配送。
  • 主题：菜鸟拓展美国市场，满足中国消费者和学生对高效且经济实惠的跨境运输的需求。
  • 观点：海外中国消费者对集运服务日益增长的需求，特别是在美国。
  • 主要信息：集运服务的详细信息，包括配送时间、节省成本和支持的运输路线；菜鸟计划在香港进行 10 亿美元的首次公开募股；菜鸟作为阿里巴巴物流骨干的作用及其在跨境电子商务中的记录。

单词：

  • parcel (n.) - /ˈpɑːrsəl/ 包裹。

    原文例句：If the parcel is sent via air, delivery times may be reduced five days after the items are sent out from the warehouse.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古法语，表示“小部分，包裹”。在这个例句中，它指的是包裹。

  • consolidated (adj.) - /kənˈsɑːləˌdeɪtɪd/ 合并的，集中的。

    原文例句：Cainiao provided consolidated shipping to shoppers in other markets outside mainland China, including Hong Kong, Singapore and Australia.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语，由con-（共同）和solid（固体）组成，表示“使固体，使巩固，使集中，使合并”。在这个例句中，它表示合并的，集中的。

  • revenue (n.) - /ˈrev.əˌnjuː/ 收入。

    原文例句：In the third quarter of 2023, Best’s global businesses achieved revenue of US$37.7 million, contributing to 12.4 per cent of the total.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语，表示“退回，收益，收入”。在这个例句中，它指的是收入。

词组：

  • across the board - 横贯整个的，全面的。

    原文例句：Cainiao has its eye on the overseas market, and recorded more than 1.5 billion cross-border e-commerce parcel deliveries in its recent financial year to March, making it one of the world’s top logistics services providers, according to its prospectus.

    例句讲解：这个词组由across（横贯，遍及）和board（董事会，委员会）组成，表示“董事会一致通过，普遍存在，全面的”。在这个例句中，它表示全面的。

句子：

  • Cainiao aims to raise at least US$1 billion, subject to market conditions, according to a Post report in September that cited people familiar with the situation. - 据邮报 9 月份的一篇报道称，菜鸟的目标是筹集至少 10 亿美元，具体取决于市场状况，该报道援引了熟悉此情况的人士的话。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Cainiao aims to raise at least US$1 billion，其中主语是Cainiao，谓语是aims to raise。at least US$1 billion是一个宾语，表示10亿美元。subject to market conditions是一个条件状语，表示在市场状况允许的情况下。according to a Post report in September that cited people familiar with the situation是一个时间状语，表示据邮报9月份的一篇报道称。该报道援引了熟悉此情况的人士的话。这个句子的意思是说，据邮报9月份的一篇报道称，菜鸟的目标是筹集至少10亿美元，具体取决于市场状况，该报道援引了熟悉此情况的人士的话。

语法：

  • 强调句型 - 表示对某个部分的强调。

    原文例句：It is the first time Cainiao has offered its consolidated shipping service to consumers in the US.

    语法讲解：强调句的基本结构是：It is/was + 被强调部分 + that/who + 其他部分。在这个例句中，被强调的部分是the first time，that从句是对It is the first time的解释，表示这是菜鸟第一次向美国消费者提供其合并运输服务。

  • Cainiao said cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers in US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese sites
  • The so-called ‘consolidated shipping’ service covers both air and sea transport routes

Cainiao, Alibaba Group Holding’s logistics unit, will open a new service for consumers in the US to allow them to package several items they have bought together, cutting delivery times to as little as five days.

Cainiao said in a statement on Tuesday that the cross-border shipping service would mainly help Chinese consumers and students in the US who tend to buy lots of goods on Chinese e-commerce sites. As of 2020, there were roughly 60 million Chinese living outside the country, according to a report by Huaqiao University.

If the parcel is sent via air, delivery times may be reduced five days after the items are sent out from the warehouse. If by sea, the new service may cut the cost to as low as 12 yuan (US$1.7), depending on the size of the parcel, according to the statement.

The new overseas service comes ahead of Cainiao’s planned US$1 billion listing in Hong Kong. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

Alibaba’s AliExpress, PDD-owned Temu face supply chain challenges in South Korea

The so-called “consolidated shipping” service, covering both air and sea transport routes, will collect multiple online shopping orders placed by users on various platforms in a warehouse before shipping them from China.

Prior to its US expansion, Cainiao provided consolidated shipping to shoppers in other markets outside mainland China, including Hong Kong, Singapore and Australia.

In November, Cainiao and Alibaba were part of a consortium that made a US$57 million offer to buy Chinese logistics company Best. Best is a major courier in China and has a presence in Southeast Asia. In the third quarter of 2023, Best’s global businesses achieved revenue of US$37.7 million, contributing to 12.4 per cent of the total.

Cainiao has its eye on the overseas market, and recorded more than 1.5 billion cross-border e-commerce parcel deliveries in its recent financial year to March, making it one of the world’s top logistics services providers, according to its prospectus.

Cainiao aims to raise at least US$1 billion, subject to market conditions, according to a Post report in September that cited people familiar with the situation. The listing is part of a group-wide restructuring of Alibaba, as the e-commerce titan seeks to free up decision- making amid increased competition.

Established in 2013, Cainiao serves as the logistics backbone of Alibaba’s e-commerce empire, handling more than 4 million cross-border parcels on a daily basis in 2023. Alibaba announced it would spin off Cainiao in the restructuring announced in March.

item.title: CES 2024: China TV makers Hisense and TCL promote AI, live sports at US show
item.description:
English Summary：

  • Hisense and TCL, two Chinese TV brands, unveiled their latest line-ups at CES 2024, emphasizing AI and making screens the centerpiece of the home.
  • Hisense showcased its AI chipsets and mini-LED TVs, while TCL introduced a 115-inch mini-LED TV and AI processing enhancements.
  • Both companies highlighted their global presence and manufacturing capabilities, aiming to provide consumers with the latest technology at affordable prices.
  • TCL also showcased its RayNeo X2 smart glasses and Nxtpaper display technology, while Hisense hinted at upcoming AR glasses and a virtual reality headset.
  • Hisense demonstrated its projector technology for cars, turning the windscreen into an AR display to enhance safety and provide real-time information to drivers.
  • The presentations showcased the focus on AI, mini-LED technology, and the integration of technology across multiple devices and platforms.

中文总结：

  • 海信和TCL，两家中国电视品牌，在2024年的CES上推出最新产品阵容，强调人工智能并使屏幕成为家庭的中心。
  • 海信展示了其人工智能芯片组和mini-LED电视，TCL则推出115英寸mini-LED电视和人工智能处理增强功能。
  • 两家公司强调了其全球影响力和制造能力，旨在为消费者提供价格适中的最新技术。
  • TCL还展示了其RayNeo X2智能眼镜和Nxtpaper显示屏技术，而海信则暗示了即将推出的AR眼镜和虚拟现实头盔。
  • 海信展示了其汽车投影技术，将挡风玻璃变成AR显示屏以提高安全性并向驾驶员提供实时信息。
  • 这些演示展示了对人工智能、mini-LED技术以及跨多个设备和平台整合技术的关注。

单词：

  • component (n.) - /kəmˈpoʊnənt/ 成分，组成部分。

    原文例句：Gold said after the Hisense presentation, “We have all the ingredients, all the components.”

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由com-（共同）和ponere（放置）组成，表示“一块一块组合起来的东西，组成部分”。在这个例句中，它指的是组成海信的各种成分或组件。

  • prowess (n.) - /ˈpraʊəs/ 技艺，技能，能力。

    原文例句：They also boasted about their supply chain prowess and the ability to manufacture leading technologies in-house.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于old French，由prow（勇敢）和esse（存在）组成，表示“过人的技能或能力”。在这个例句中，它指的是海信和TCL在供应链和制造方面的能力和技能。

词组：

  • leading technology - 领先技术。

    原文例句：They also boasted about their supply chain prowess and the ability to manufacture leading technologies in-house.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由leading（领先的）和technology（技术）构成的，表示“领先的技术或技术创新”。在这个例句中，它指的是海信和TCL能够生产领先的技术，并将这些技术应用到自己的产品中。

  • turn into - 变为，变成。

    原文例句：Hisense is working on bringing its projector technology into cars to, among other things, turn the windscreen into an AR display.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由turn（转向）和into（变成）构成的，表示“转变为，变成”。在这个例句中，它指的是海信正在努力将投影技术应用到汽车中，并将挡风玻璃变成AR显示屏。

句子：

  • Gold said after the Hisense presentation, “We have all the ingredients, all the components. There are very few companies out there that can do the same.” - 高德在海信演示后说，“我们拥有所有成分，所有组件。很少有其他公司能够做到这一点。”

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是There are very few companies out there that can do the same，其中主语是There，谓语是are，宾语是very few companies out there that can do the same。Gold said after the Hisense presentation, “We have all the ingredients, all the components.”是一个引语，表示高德在海信演示后说，“我们拥有所有成分，所有组件”。这个句子的意思是说，海信拥有提供智能家居解决方案所需的所有成分和组件，很少有其他公司能够做到这一点。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示一段时间内发生的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Hisense said that mini LEDs – which cram more LEDs into a display to offer a greater range of contrast and image quality – are now integrated into all its models, including one for under US$500.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 过去分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，过去分词是动词的-ed形式。这种时态表示一段时间内发生的动作或状态，强调动作或状态的完成性。在这个例句中，它表示海信已经将mini LED集成到其所有型号中，包括一款售价低于500美元的型号。

  • 虚拟语气 - 用来表达说话人的建议、愿望、设想等。

    原文例句：Gold said, “Usually you put in one setting and never change it again. What we’re trying to do with AI is automatically detect, ‘Oh, now you’re watching football, let’s move to a sport setting’.”

    语法讲解：虚拟语气是一种语气，用来表达说话人的建议、愿望、设想等。虚拟语气有两种形式：现在虚拟语气和过去虚拟语气。现在虚拟语气用在主句谓语用一般现在时或一般将来时，从句谓语用过去时或过去完成时。在这个例句中，Gold所说的“What we’re trying to do with AI is automatically detect, ‘Oh, now you’re watching football, let’s move to a sport setting’”就是一个虚拟语气从句，表示海信试图使用人工智能自动检测用户正在观看的内容并切换到运动模式。

  • The two biggest Chinese TV brands offered competing narratives about their global stature and AI processing capabilities
  • The companies emphasised their ability to produce much of their technology in-house and how they are branching out into areas like AR

Chinese television set makers Hisense and TCL unveiled their latest line-ups at CES 2024 in Las Vegas on Monday, with an emphasis on artificial intelligence (AI) and making screens the centre of the home, while pushing into new areas like cars.

Both companies offered competing narratives, presenting themselves as the biggest Chinese brands in the US television space. They also boasted about their supply chain prowess and the ability to manufacture leading technologies in-house.

David Gold, president of Hisense USA, said the company’s ability to produce displays and even its own AI chipsets without third parties is something that sets it apart.

“When you think about global players, I think we are one of less than a handful of companies that have everything that it takes to be able to truly provide a smart home solution,” Gold said after the Hisense presentation. “We have all the ingredients, all the components. There are very few companies out there that can do the same.”

Tech giants Alibaba, ByteDance lead China’s return to CES

The flagship product from Hisense this year is its new 110-inch ULED X television with a brightness of 10,000 nits and 40,000 backlight zones.

Not to be outdone, TCL announced what it said is the world’s largest mini-LED TV at 115 inches. TCL referred to itself as a “great global power” with 32 research and development centres and 43 manufacturing sites around the world.

Mini LEDs featured prominently in the presentations of both Hisense and TCL, as they each presented their brands as the best option for finding this tech in TVs that cost just a few hundred dollars, rather than thousands.

Hisense said that mini LEDs – which cram more LEDs into a display to offer a greater range of contrast and image quality – are now integrated into all its models, including one for under US$500.

Hisense also introduced its new so-called laser TVs, which are projectors combined with an ambient-light-rejecting screen. The company said its newest 8K Sonic Laser TV is the “world’s largest sound-emitting screen”, offering a sound bar-like experience built into the projector. It is also offering a new Rollable Laser TV, which is exactly what it sounds like: a projector screen that rolls up and disappears, offering a cleaner look at home when not in use.

Both companies used sports to draw attention to their new TVs. As more viewers switch to streaming, the focus on live television has largely fallen to sports, a major reason households remain subscribed to cable and satellite TV packages.

TCL leaned into this heavily, inviting sportscasters including Charissa Thompson and former National Football League player Charles Woodson on stage for nearly the entire duration of the presentation.

Hisense highlighted the ability of its AI chips to enhance picture quality by identifying whether the video is coming from streaming, cable or another source.

“[Our AI is] about recognising what content it is, the quality, the factor in which it’s being displayed – whether it’s streaming, cable, DVDs, Blu-ray – and finding the way to enhance that picture quality,” Gold said. “Usually you put in one setting and never change it again. What we’re trying to do with AI is automatically detect, ‘Oh, now you’re watching football, let’s move to a sport setting’.”

Seemingly omnipresent at CES 2024, AI was mentioned repeatedly during both presentations, as it has been by rivals like Samsung and LG.

TCL talked of enhancing access to its AI processing with three levels of its AIPQ processors, which include “pro” and “ultra” versions. The AI processors are now offered in its cheaper S Class series.

While TVs are typically the highlight for these events from the Chinese display giants, they are also chasing other trends in the industry. TCL mentioned the latest version of the RayNeo X2 smart glasses, which can display images on the lenses to do things like offer real-time text translation. TCL incubated RayNeo.

The company also highlighted its newest smartphones and tablets with an emphasis on its Nxtpaper display, which is meant to be easier on the eyes like e-reader displays.

Hisense is working on its own augmented reality (AR) glasses and a virtual reality headset, but both are just prototypes for now.

It has also followed many of its Chinese peers – like Xiaomi and Huawei Technologies – into the auto sector. It is working on bringing its projector technology into cars to, among other things, turn the windscreen into an AR display. The company said this enhances safety because drivers do not need to take their eyes off the road when getting information like navigation.

“If you’re on the road and your smart refrigerator can tell you, ‘hey, you’re out of eggs; so on your way home, stop by and pick up some eggs,’ that’s the idea that we’re going for,” Gold said.

Many tech firms are betting on cars as the next big area of growth. As leaders in electric vehicles, Chinese companies are benefiting from the trend. Carmakers Li Auto, Great Wall Motor, Zeekr and Xiaomi will all use Nvidia’s Drive tech for autonomous driving, the chip firm announced on Monday.

Samsung and Sony also discussed their own partnerships with carmakers in their presentations on Monday. Sony has partnered with Honda on its Afeela joint venture, while Samsung is partnering with Hyundai to bring its SmartThings platform to cars.
